document.text: VIRGINIA IN THE CIRCUIT C O U R T OF APPOMATTOX COUNTY COLONIAL PIPELIN E COM PANY, a Virgnia Corporation petitioner VS NOTICE OF PUBLICATION HERMAN A. GLENN 44 6th St. Atlantic Beach, Florida OTIS GILLIAM Somet l i n e s known and called Otis Gilliam 2718 Carolina Ave. Roanoke, Va. MARY GILLIAM Sometimes known and called Mary Gilliam 2718 Carolina Ave. Roanoke, Va. HERBERT E . GILLIAM Some times called Herbert B. Gilliam 384 South Lake Drive Roanoke, Va. and 50 acres of land, more or less, more particularly described1 as the residue of a 75 acre tract conveyed by deed dated July 11, 1898 from ft. p . Glenn and Ida M. Glenn to Molly B. Glenn as found in the records of Appb- mattox County, State of Virginia, in Deed Book No. 5 at page 234 therof  and also, 75 acres of land, more or less, more particularly de scribed as the residue of a 150 acre tract described in a deed! dated1 December 18, 1886 from Sarìiùèl Wheeler, et toc, to Liith- èr R. Glenn recorded in Deed Book No. 2, at page 166 of the Clerks Office of Appomattox County, Vif-gihia Defendants Notice by Publication TO WHOM IT M ÀY CONCERN Pursuant to an order entered on the 29th day of May, 1963, this Notice is hereby given tn this proceeding the Petition er seeks to acquire by con demnation certain rights, privi leges and easements of right of way over, litoti and across cer tain pieces or parcels of land situated in Appomattox County, Virginia, for the uses and pur poses of the Petitioner In the construction, maintenance, in spection, operation, protection, repair, replacement, change of size and removal of a pipe line fot the transportation of petrol eum products and or any other liquids or gases as a common carrier for the public, which are fully described in the petition and exhibits attached thereto on file in the offlfee of the clferk of this fcourt, to which reference is here by made for a full and accurate description thereof and for the appointment of commissioners to ascertain JUst compensation to the owners of any estate or in terest in the property to be taken dr affected as a result of the taking arid use thereof by the Petitioner. For such purposes, the Fetit- doher will apply to the Court sitting at Appomattox, Virginia, ori the 29th day of June, 1963, at 1600 oclock a.m ., or as soon thereafter as Petitioner may be heard, for the appointment of commissioners to ascertain just compensation as aforesaid. And it appearing by affidavit filed according to law that the following owner is not a resident of the State of Virginia, namely, Herman A. Gletln whose address is 44 6th Street, Atlantic Beach, Florida and that this is his last known and in fact correct pre sent address. It is ORDERED that the afore said owner do appear within ten 10 days after due publication of this order in the Clerks Office of the Circuit Court of Appomat tox County, Virginia, and do what is necessary to protect their interests and it is further ORDERED that if any of the above naihed owners desire to assart any objection or defense to the taking or damaging of this or his property or to the juris diction of the court to hear the case and to proceed with the appointment of commissioner, he shall file his answer and grounds of. defense designating the pro perty in which He claims to be interested, the grounds of any objection or defense to the tak ing or damaging of his property or to the jurisdiction of the court to hear the case and to proceed With the appointment of com missioners for the determination of just compensation. It having been made to appear that a public necessity and an essential public convenience re quires that the Petitioner enter upon thè property described in the Petition filed in this cause for the purpose of constructing its pipe line in the manner pro posed in the said Petition and it being made to appear that an emergency exists justifying an entry and further that the in terest of the owner or owners will be adequately protected by tho payment In the Court for the benefit of the said owners of the amount of the offer made by the Petitioner in accordance with Code Section 25-46.5 and the exe cuting of proper bond, the said defendant is notified that the Petitioner will move the Court for permission to enter upon the said lands and construct its faci lities prior to the determination of any award as is requested to be made in the Petition filed in this proceeding. An extract, Teste C . W. SMITH, Clerk. GEORGE ABBITT, JR . Attorney at Law Appomattox, Virginia Counsel for Colonial Pipeline Company. 6-8-2t

document.text: The purpose of this proceeding is to merge j. temporary divorce, into a permanent decree of abso lute divorce. And an affidavit having been made and filed that the defendant Allen B. Wooldridge, is not resi dent of the State of Virginia, it is ordered that he do appear with in ten days after due publication hereof, and do what may be neces sary to protect his interests in this suit. And it is further ordered that a copy hereof be published once a week for four successive weeks in the Times-Virginian, ,a newspaper published in the County of Appo mattox, that a copy be posted at the front door of the Courthouse of this County on or before the 20th day of August, 1945, that be ing the next succeeding Rule day after this order was entered, and that the Clerk mail a copy hereof to each of the said defendants to the post office address given in the affidavit herein, and file a cer tificate of the fact in the papers of this case. A CopyTest  C. W. Smith. Clerk. George Abbitt, Jr., p. q. 8-16-4tc
